Scholarships Endowed by the University of Oregon for International Students: You can learn more about the world by earning a degree from an American university, like the University of Oregon in Eugene. It has established endowed scholarships to assist international students with financial aid for the 2024–2024 academic year.

The University of Oregon’s Tuition Endowed Scholarships for International Students programs are made possible by the generosity of donors and aim to provide international students pursuing an undergraduate or graduate degree with financial assistance. Students who demonstrate a need for financial assistance and perform well in school will be eligible to receive the full grant, which covers the full tuition cost.

The University of Oregon is a public research-focused higher education institution located in Eugene, Oregon. It was founded in 1876 and is well-known for its close ties to Nike, Inc., the sportswear and marketing powerhouse, as well as its eccentric co-founder, millionaire Phil Knight. Out of a total of 443, the university ranks 105th on the list of the nation’s best universities.

The University of Oregon is committed to developing the next generation of transformative leaders and informed global citizens by providing an education that emphasizes individual growth. In the classroom, research, and community service, it strives for excellence. We take a humane approach to the process of coming up with great ideas.

  • University Name: University of Oregon (UO)
  • Study Level: Bachelor / Masters Degree

  • Access Mode: Online
  • Nationality: International
  • The award can be taken in the USA.
  • Application Deadline: February 17, 2024 by 4 p.m. (PST).

Eligibility

Candidates must meet all of the following requirements in order to be eligible for the University of Oregon Tuition Endowed Scholarships:

  • Any international student may apply.
  • A bachelor’s or master’s degree program offered by the University of Oregon is open to applicants.
  • Candidates must meet all of the following requirements in order to be considered:
  • The applicants must be eligible for admission to the University of Oregon or fully admitted.
  • The applicants must not be citizens of the United States, permanent residents of the United States, or eligible for federal financial assistance.
  • The applicants are required to demonstrate financial need and have a minimum cumulative GPA of 3.0.

How Can I Apply?

To apply for the University of Oregon Tuition Endowed Scholarships, please follow the steps below:

Applying as Current University of Oregon Students

  • Login to the University of Oregon Scholarship Dashboard and submit the General Application and the ISSS Endowed Scholarships Application.
  • All applications and Reference Letters must be submitted by February 17, 2024 by 4 p.m. (PST).

Applying as Incoming freshmen and new transfer, new graduate and new post baccalaureate applicant

  • YOUR FIRST STEP: You must apply for Admission to the University of Oregon before you can apply for scholarships.
  • Watch your email for an invitation to enter the University of Oregon Tuition Endowed Scholarships Dashboard. This happens within a week of submitting your application for admissions.
  • Login to the University of Oregon Scholarship Dashboard and submit the General Application, ISSS Endowed Scholarships Application and the ICSP Scholarship Application.  You must apply for admission prior to this step.
  • All applications and Reference Letters must be submitted by February 17, 2024 by 4 p.m. (PST).

Supporting Documents: The students are required to present the following documents to the university:

    • High school transcripts
    • Personal statement
  • Admission Requirements: The applicants must meet the admission requirements of the university, such as high school graduation or a relevant bachelor’s degree qualification.
  • Language Requirement: The students must submit scores of the following English language proficiency tests:
    • TOEFL PBT – 500
    • TOEFL IBT – 61
    • IELTS – 5.0
    • Satisfactory completion of level 112 in an English Language School

Note: If you experience any technical difficulties with the form please email issa@uoregon.edu for help.

Scholarship Benefits

The University of Oregon Tuition Endowed Scholarships will provide the recipient with the following benefits:

  • The successfully selected students can expect to be awarded a scholarship worth full tuition fee coverage of the program undertaken by them at the University of Oregon.
